main event: A witness in Proctor, Minnesota reported seeing a round, red and white flashing object in the sky on March 28, 1967. The object exhibited erratic flight behavior and made frequent course changes.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a baseball at arm's length, though the observer seemed unsure of the size.
The object made a roaring sound that was different from a jet aircraft.
Many other people in Proctor had reportedly seen similar objects recently.
The sighting lasted for about 20 minutes, and the object was seen and heard again an hour later, briefly.
There was unusual cloud activity detected in the area around the time of the sighting, with a spray-defined paint detected by a height finder.
sighted object: round, red and white flashing object
